name: Marketing Guideline Compliance Check
content:
Marketing Guideline Compliance Check


Data Folder:

Drive Link: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/14EMlCz9ChA7e3lZFcZf3NMXqu_1qhiPW


Objective

The purpose of this application is to assess the compliance of marketing documents with established guidelines. Specifically, it evaluates:

  1. Comprehensive Marketing Communication Document: This is the primary marketing material under review.
  2. Marketing Guideline Document: This outlines the rules and standards for creating marketing materials.

The goal is to determine whether the marketing document adheres to the standards and requirements outlined in the guideline document, ensuring compliance and consistency.


Importance of Compliance

Ensuring compliance with marketing guidelines is essential for:

  • Brand Consistency: Maintaining a unified brand identity across all materials.
  • Legal Adherence: Ensuring all marketing content aligns with legal and regulatory standards.
  • Ethical Practices: Upholding ethical guidelines in marketing communications.


Steps for Compliance Assessment

1. Initial Review

  • Objective: Conduct a preliminary check to determine if the marketing document aligns with the outlined guidelines.
  • Process:
  • Review all sections of the marketing document against the standards specified in the guidelines.
  • Utilize AI tools to aid in assessing overall compliance.
  • Compliance Categories:
  • Fully Compliant: The document meets all guideline requirements.
  • Partially Compliant (Human Intervention Required): The document requires some revisions or clarifications to achieve full compliance.
  • Not Compliant: The document deviates significantly from the guidelines.

Example: Suppose a marketing document for a new product launch includes claims about its eco-friendliness. During the initial review, this claim is checked against the guideline's section on "Sustainability Claims." If the document lacks evidence or appropriate disclaimers, it may fall into "Partially Compliant" status.

Persona Using This Step: Sarah, a Marketing Manager, uses this tool to ensure her team’s promotional materials meet the company’s brand and legal standards before launching a new campaign.

2. Comprehensive Report Generation

  • Objective: Provide a detailed analysis of compliance status.
  • Process:
  • Use AI to generate a thorough compliance report.
  • Highlight areas of compliance and non-compliance within the marketing document.
  • Outline necessary actions to achieve full compliance.

Example: After the review, the tool generates a report showing that while the marketing document adheres to brand tone and design, it lacks required legal disclaimers. The report provides actionable suggestions to address this.

Persona Using This Step: John, a Compliance Officer, reviews the detailed report to ensure no legal or regulatory requirements are overlooked.


Expected Outcomes

  • A Compliance Score indicating the overall adherence level:
  1. Fully Compliant
  2. Partially Compliant
  3. Not Compliant
  • A Detailed Compliance Report that includes:
  • Insights into areas of alignment and deviation.
  • Recommendations for improvement or revisions.

Example: A report might indicate that 90% of the document meets guidelines, with specific annotations on sections requiring edits.


Benefits of Using This Assessment Tool

  • Efficiency: Speeds up the review process with AI assistance.
  • Accuracy: Ensures a comprehensive and unbiased evaluation.
  • Actionable Insights: Provides clear recommendations to improve compliance.


Use Case Scenario

Lisa, a Brand Strategist, is preparing a global advertising campaign. She uses this tool to ensure the campaign’s materials adhere to international marketing standards and align with the company’s values. After running the assessment, Lisa receives a compliance score and a report that allows her to address identified issues before launch.
